intro: Tithymalus deltobracteatus, commonly known as the broad-bract tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
